title: Add access logging, database export, enhanced login UX, copy buttons, footer links, and premium visual effects

requirements.summary: Create an 'Activity Logs' section in the Admin Panel displaying access logs with Client ID, timestamp, and source IP address
acceptanceCriteria: Admin Panel displays an 'Activity Logs' section with a table or list view
Each log entry shows Client ID, timestamp with date and time, and IP address
Logs are fetched from the backend and displayed in chronological order
Log entries are created automatically when clients log in

file_operations.description: Add useAccessLogs query hook that calls backend getAccessLogs() method and returns the array of AccessLog records with automatic refetching

Create table component displaying access logs with columns for Client ID, formatted timestamp (date and time), and IP address. Use the useAccessLogs hook to fetch data and display in chronological order (newest first). Include loading and error states.
Add new 'Activity Logs' tab to the TabsList and corresponding TabsContent section. Import and render the ActivityLogsTable component within the new tab content area.
After successful client authentication, call backend logAccess() method with clientId and client's IP address to create an access log entry before navigating to dashboard

requirements.summary: Add an 'Export Database' button in the Admin Panel that generates and downloads a JSON or CSV file containing all client data
acceptanceCriteria: Admin Panel has an 'Export Database' button clearly visible
Clicking the button triggers download of a file containing all client data
Export file includes Client ID, IP address, username, and password for each client
File format is either JSON or CSV

file_operations.description: Create button component that fetches all client records using the existing useAllClientRecords hook, transforms the data into JSON format including idLuid, ipVps, userVps, senhaVps, nome, senhaCliente, plano, planExpiry, vmStatus, and operatingSystem fields, then triggers a browser download of the JSON file with filename 'luid-database-export-YYYY-MM-DD.json'. Include loading state during data fetch and export.
Import and render the DatabaseExportButton component in the Admin Panel header area, positioned near the logout button for easy admin access

requirements.summary: Display a styled red error alert on the client login page when an invalid Client ID is entered
acceptanceCriteria: Invalid Client ID triggers a visible error message in red
Error message displays: '⚠️ ID not identified. Please check your contract or contact our support team.'
Error is shown as a Toast notification or Modal dialog
Error styling is consistent with the application theme

file_operations.description: Update the login error handling to display a toast notification with red/destructive variant when authentication fails due to invalid Client ID. Set the toast message to '⚠️ ID not identified. Please check your contract or contact our support team.' using the existing toast system.

requirements.summary: Add a green neon loading effect to the client login page during authentication processing
acceptanceCriteria: Login button shows a green neon loading indicator when clicked
Loading effect is visible during authentication processing
Loading effect uses the neon green color from the theme
Loading effect stops when authentication completes or fails

file_operations.description: Add loading state management to the login form. When the Enter button is clicked, display a neon green animated loading spinner or pulsing effect using the theme's neon-green color. Show the loading indicator on the button during the authentication process and hide it when login completes or fails.

requirements.summary: Add copy buttons next to IP address, username, and password fields in the Client Dashboard with clipboard functionality
acceptanceCriteria: Copy button with clipboard icon appears next to IP address field
Copy button with clipboard icon appears next to username field
Copy button with clipboard icon appears next to password field
Clicking a copy button copies the corresponding value to clipboard
A 'Copied!' confirmation message appears after successful copy

file_operations.description: Add copy-to-clipboard button with clipboard icon next to the IP address, username (userVps), and password (senhaVps) fields. Implement clipboard API functionality that copies the value when clicked and displays a 'Copied!' toast notification. Style buttons to match the theme.

requirements.summary: Add footer links for 'Terms of Use' and 'Privacy Policy' in the Client Dashboard with placeholder content
acceptanceCriteria: Client Dashboard footer displays 'Terms of Use' link
Client Dashboard footer displays 'Privacy Policy' link
Links open pages or modals with placeholder generic text
Footer styling is consistent with the application theme

file_operations.description: Add 'Terms of Use' and 'Privacy Policy' links to the footer component. Style the links to match the neon-green theme. Links should trigger modals or navigate to placeholder content pages.

Create a modal dialog component that displays legal content (Terms of Use or Privacy Policy) with placeholder generic text. Include a title prop to distinguish between the two documents and a close button. Use placeholder lorem ipsum or generic legal text that can be edited later.
Import and render the updated Footer component to ensure the legal links are visible in the Client Dashboard

requirements.summary: Apply a green glow effect to information cards throughout the application for premium visual appearance
acceptanceCriteria: Information cards display a soft green glow effect
Glow effect uses the neon green color from the theme
Effect is applied consistently across all information cards
Glow enhances visual appeal without reducing readability

file_operations.description: Add a custom CSS class for card glow effect using box-shadow with the neon-green color from the theme. Define the glow as a subtle outer shadow that creates a premium appearance without overwhelming the content. Include hover state enhancement if appropriate.
Apply the new card glow CSS class to the Card component to add the green glow effect
Apply the new card glow CSS class to the Card component to add the green glow effect
Apply the new card glow CSS class to the Card component wrapper to add the green glow effect
Apply the new card glow CSS class to the Card component to add the green glow effect
Apply the new card glow CSS class to the Card component to add the green glow effect

requirements.summary: Add a green indicator dot to the Support Chat widget showing 'High Availability' operational status
acceptanceCriteria: Support Chat widget displays a green indicator dot
Indicator visually communicates 'High Availability' status
Green color matches the neon green theme
Indicator is clearly visible when chat widget is displayed

file_operations.description: Add a green indicator dot (pulsing animation recommended) to the chat widget header or toggle button. Position the dot prominently to indicate 'High Availability' status. Use the neon-green theme color and ensure the indicator is visible when the chat is both open and collapsed. Add tooltip or label text indicating 'High Availability' when hovered.
